paper_abstract: If C is a connected graph with vertex set V(C), then the degree distance of C is defined as DD(G) = Sigma({u, v}is an element of V(G)) (deg u + deg v)d(u, v), where deg u is the degree of vertex u, and d(u, v) denotes the distance between a and v. In the chemical literature. DD(G) is better known under the name Schultz index, introduced by Gutman. In the elms of partial Hamming graphs, which include trees, benzenoid and phenylene systems among others, we express the degree distance in terms of the canonical metric representation, tines simplifying its computation
paper_title: CALCULATING THE DEGREE DISTANCE OF PARTIAL HAMMING GRAPHS
